instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: Mba 3024
threads.message: Had a 3024 come through. History of liquid damage near DCIN Connector. Also shorted <CHIP>U7720</CHIP>. Board was "dead" though running... No fan. Restored <SIGNAL>P1V8_S0</SIGNAL> Got fan to spin, and computer to start up. Only problem now is that the light on the charger stays green despite a dead battery, and still shows possible charging. When I disconnect the charger, the screen goes dark, but the fan keeps spinning... anyone have any suggestions?

threads.title: Mba 3024
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22397"]Bad IO board/cable.[/QUOTE]

[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] forgot to mention that I already put in a known good one... is there a designated display circuit for DCIN? Thanks for your help

threads.title: Mba 3024
threads.message: Must be an issue with <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>, so could also be the trackpad cable/connectors.
